title: Nabelah Al-Neghaimshi discusses ‘The Price of Freedom’
text:
As an author and speaker in the fields of self-development and quality of life, Nabelah Al-Neghaimshi encountered people who share their concerns with him. Many requested her advice about their suffering from the presence of an authoritarian person in their life, which inspired her to write “ The Price of Freedom ” (published by AuthorHouse UK). This bold book discusses the authoritarian behavior , the reasons for its emergence, characteristics and methods to control others. It demonstrates the conduct of the victim of an authoritarian person as well as suggestions and practical solutions for self-protection and liberation that is based on behavioral psychology, complementary medicine and Islam.
“ Freedom is a right to all humans” Al-Neghaimshi points out. “Most people practice authoritarianism with some people and at the same time exercise the role of the victim with others. It is essential to raise personal awareness to eliminate the authoritarian tendency that is cruel and causes harm to others. And it is equally important to protect oneself from being a victim. Freedom is a fundamental requirement for justice , happiness and progress.”
Through the publication of “The Price of Freedom,” Al-Neghaimshi hopes to motivate readers to increase their self-esteem, communicate with themselves and create clear personal goals for them to live a high-quality life.
“The Price of Freedom”
By Nabelah Al-Neghaimshi

Nabelah Al-Neghaimshi is an author and speaker in the fields of self-development and quality of life. He earned Bachelor of Science in physics and mathematics, High Diploma in family counseling, Master of Arts in counseling in addition to many certified training courses from different parts of the world. Her career spans more than 32 years. After retirement, she started organizing and heading self-development conferences and activities. She also hosted a national TV show that discussed social issues and helped to produce it. She wrote books in Arabic. Three of her books were translated into English.
